Patent Information.Patent Title: Anti-microbial Peptides And Methods Of Use Thereof
Patent Information.Abstract: Anti-microbial peptides and methods of use are provided.

Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.18942691]Gram-positive bacteria:Bacillus subtilis (MIC=0.8 µM), Staphylococcus aureus (MIC=6.8 µM);Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli (MIC=2.0 µM), Pseudomonas aeruginosa (MIC=18.5 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.18942691]LC50>100 μM against rat red blood cells
Sequence Information.Function: Has antimicrobial activity against Gram-positive bacteria as well as Gram-negative bacteria. Stimulates degranulation from rat peritoneal mast cells with an EC50 of 19.4 µM. Has weak hemolytic activity towards rat erythrocytes.

Literature.Title: Melectin a novel antimicrobial peptide from the venom of the cleptoparasitic bee Melecta albifrons.
Literature.Author: Cerovský V, Hovorka O, Cvacka J, Voburka Z, Bednárová L, Borovicková L, Slaninová J, Fucík V.

Literature.Title: Melectin: a novel antimicrobial peptide from the venom of the cleptoparasitic bee Melecta albifrons.
Literature.Author: Bednarova L.,Voburka Z.,Cvacka J.,Hovorka O.,Cerovsky V.
